definition: abbr. for the Big Dipper constellation 北斗星[Bei3 dou3 xing1]
to fight/to struggle/to condemn/to censure/to contend/to put together/coming together
dry measure for grain equal to ten 升[sheng1] or one-tenth of a 石[dan4]/decaliter/peck/cup or dipper shaped object/old variant of 陡[dou3]
to strive for/to vie for/to argue or debate/deficient or lacking (dialect)/how or what (literary)

sentences.english: Instead, the report says internal power struggles have left the government lacking cohesion.
sentences.chinese: 相反，报告说，内部权力斗争使得政府缺乏一致性。

sentences.english: No country is spared from power struggle which is part and parcel of politics.
sentences.chinese: 有政治就必然有权力斗争，任何国家都概莫能外。

definition: scramble for power and profit (idiom); power struggle
internal strife/power struggle/(of members of an organization) to fight each other
to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
to fight and scheme against each other (idiom)/(in palace construction) elaborate and refined
variant of 勾心鬥角|勾心斗角[gou1 xin1 dou4 jiao3]
art of politics/political tricks (often derog.)/power play/to play at politics/underhand trickery
